climbs.name: Moms Spaghetti
climbs.fa: Probably Jason Baker but maybe Angus Meredith

content.description: Jugs to big gaston crux and hard move to a pinch. Common spot for spider webs.
content.location: Lower block below death fall wall. Overhanging part on the large pyramid boulder. Start sitting with jug ledges and move up then right to the obvious gaston then back left to the lip jugs. can walk down the backside of the boulder.

content.description: Star Destroyer shaped boulder below the main wall. Powerful slapping moves on the left and jugs and ledges on the right. It long but falls aren't bad (you'll see when you get there)
content.location: Start low in the hole left hand crimp and right hand undercling. Slap to arete and move your way to the tip of the climb.

content.description:
The difficult part of this climb is the bouldery moves down low over a roof. The climbing eases off a bit after that but becomes run out to the bolts. Clipping the 3rd bolt could be pretty scary if you aren't in a good stance as there may be groundfall potential.

Per Scott's comments I've edited the route description to no longer reflect the R rating that this climb used to carry as it has been retrobolted to be a safer lead. Thanks Scott.
content.protection: 7 bolts - bolt anchor located at top of cliff.
content.location: Just left of the large roof of death Fall Wall.

content.description: Begin on the prominent horizontal rails on the beautiful smooth rock just left of Death Fall. Make a few large (though still possibly static) moves down low, following the lighter rock up and slightly left to the most prominent roof. Two options here: the first breaks left around the roof, then cuts back right traversing just above the roof and up to the chains. The second pulls the roof - more difficult.
Crux is low after the first bolt getting above the overhang
content.protection: 5 quickdraws.  Anchor at the top, but its hard to set a top rope on.  Bring something to extend the anchor with
content.location: Starts to the right of the overhang with easy climbing.

content.description:
This is a very fun route on the far left side of Death Fall Wall. The crux is moving through the first two bolts (glue ins).

Please comment if you have info on this route, as I have none.
content.protection: A handful of bolts leads up the wall until the route merges into "Blowout" to reach its two bolt anchor with chains.
content.location: Far left of Death Fall Wall, to the left of Death Blocks. Blowout (on the far right of Alpha Wall) is just left of this route.

content.description: A really fun balancy route, probably the best on this wall.  This route starts atthe ramp with all the hash marks on it. Walk up the ramp to clip the second bolt of Death Fall Direct (OUT ON YOUR LEFT).

A very fun boulder problem brings you to your first opportunity for gear about 30 feet up. Enjoy thrilling sequences on good holds through very steep terrain for the grade. The cost of entry is the loose nature of the blocks that give the route its name. Many of the blocks are big and only temporarily attached to the face. Protection is marginal and hard to get. The kind of route that you do once, and never again!
content.protection: Don’t fall, but bring a rack to 3” with emphasis on small cams.
content.location: To the left of Jude, the route climbs the obvious big holds to juggy, overhanging loose blocks above.
